r a b b i t s page 2 t h e p a t t e r n i n s t r u c t i o n s the deer is made using exactly the same instructions as written in either of my fox patterns there are however some differences in the yarn used and in construction for yarn a use a mid brown colour instead of a rust and for yarn b a beige colour instead of cream here i have used cascade 220 worsted yarn in praline 9695 yarn a and beige 8021 yarn b the ears are joined to the sides of the head rather than the top as in the fox see notes on ears below once the ears are joined there are optional antlers to make see antler instructions on page 4 after joining the ears and antlers speckles are embroidered onto the top of the head using duplicate stitch see page 5 then the eyes nose and mouth are added as detailed in the fox pattern h e a d knit finish and stuff the head exactly as detailed on page 3 of the fox pattern but for yarn a use a mid brown yarn instead of a rust colour and a beige yarn instead of cream for yarn b e a r s make two the same make the ears exactly as detailed on either page 5 or page 16 of the fox pattern but for yarn a use a mid brown yarn instead of a rust colour and for yarn b a beige yarn instead of cream don t use black yarn to tip the outer ear instead work it entirely in yarn a fig 1 back & front once the ears are finished and sewn together using the instructions on page 6 or page 16 of the fox pattern use the cast on tail to sew together the front edges at the base of each ear fig 1 folded join the ears to the sides of the head aligning them 4 row back from the inner edge of the first row of lighter colour on the cheek fig 2 use the two yarn a tails from the ear to join both the top side
